question: Which country's longest river is "Loire River"?
explanation: Loire River is a 1012 kilometer long river which forms the longest river in France and covers more than a fifth of France's land area. Loire River rises from the Massif Central of France and drains at the Atlantic Ocean. The central part of the Loire Valley was added to the World Heritage Sites list of UNESCO. The Loire Valley has been called the "Garden of France" and is housed with over a thousand chateaux, each with distinct architectural embellishments of the early medieval to the late Renaissance periods.
